website_summaries.verdict: The best cable modem-router combo for smart homes, and anyone who needs lag-free 4K video streaming and fast-paced online gaming.
pros: Features a wide array of ports
Easy to customize a home network
cons: You may save money over renting in the long run, but this still is a big-ticket model

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy:  Charter/Spectrum - Multiple Resets probably due to Intel PUMA6 chipset
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy: Purchased the ASUS CM-16 a little over a year ago. ISP is Charter / Spectrum. Device has required modem reset every 1-3 days. Spectrum called multiple times, and did two site visits --- signal ok. Also I added signal amplifier, just in case. After research, I found that this modem as well as many others uses the Intel PUMA6 chipset which is known for requiring resets. Suggest you search "Intel PUMA6" to find out if the modem you are purchasing has that chipset - many different mfg use it. I purchased one based on another chip and have had solid performance since -- not a single reset. Too late for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Seniorpaddler

customer_reviews.title: This model has bugs in firmware
customer_reviews.text: had issues with this particular model.. CM-32. Asus customer service told me couldn't help me because Comcast holds rights for firmware. Asus said had no firmware updates.. Replaced with other Asus model and no more issues
customer_reviews.author: Ivan P.

customer_reviews.title: GAMERS BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: Please do not waste your time if you’re a gamer. 1. You will not have an Open NAT even with port forwarding. 2. ASUS does not support this modem with updates. 3. It’s a horrible mess of software bugs and you need to steer clear of this router. 4. Have had frequent drops in connection in the box. 5. ASUS only does email replies for this products. No live chat or person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set up is easy. So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Connected at speeds I pay for. 1. Don't bother contacting cable company. Just connect as instructed. Set up is easy. So far so good. No going back and forth with comcast and " other modem company " took 5 mins not 5 hrs to get back online, not one call to comcast... And to be clear, this review is for the ASUS CM-16 Modem. Amazon has the tendency to group all review together, not sure why. Anyway, we also picked up the Asus AC2900  , i mean, worth every penny so far. Thank you Asus. Now, Asus should come out with a modem that will support 1 gig + of speed soon.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondgirl

customer_reviews.title: Not my internet provider because the Netgear modem worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not buy this! I replaced my Netgear modem with this one thinking it will speed things up on the wifi side. It's more than 70% slower than my own modem+router combo.The wifi radios don't work well and the 5G radio on my unit was broken (not broadcasting even though its turned on through the software). It's not a cheap device. I would return it if I could but it took me forever to set it up (the software does not work well, keeps timing out). Not my internet provider because the Netgear modem worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Phan

customer_reviews.title: Router stopped working after a month
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and I got my expected speed after I installed it . Everything was good for a month and then the problem started . It was keep dropping the SSID which caused my devices to lose their connections . I called the customer service and they said despite that it says supported by Cox but it's not ! . seems like it doesn't work well if you have Cox as your ISP however I believe the issue was the router itself.
customer_reviews.author: Alireza

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but was obviously a used product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this modem for Spectrum cable Internet, it works really well and is much more stable than my older Arris modem. However this was obviously a returned product. The cables did not have wire ties on any of them, and the paperwork was a little worn. Additionally when I provisioned the cable modem with Spectrum they had mentioned that this MAC had a quarantine on it and I had to call another number to get the quarantine on the modem lifted.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced possibly broken used product at a high price.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in a big cardboard box with loose pieces wrapped in bubble wrap. Obviously used equipment. No manufacturer box, no instructions. Did not work with Spectrum Cable. Maybe it was broken or maybe not compatible. Simply the absolute worst value item I have purchadef from Amazon in twenty years. A total ripoff. Returned same day. Beware! You might get the same unit I returned. Terrible product plus high price equals one extremely unsatisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Signals are weak.
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I was expecting. Setup did not go well. Called customer service, they would NOT talk on the phone. Only text!!! They were absolutely no help with setup. Called a IT friend who hoped out. Quality of signal weaker than expected. Its better than the xfinity box but honestly there are better out there. The cost is way too high for what you get. My opinion, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Lerback

customer_reviews.title: 400mb down / 20 mb up on Spectrum - Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after seeing reviews about the processor but I have experienced 0 issues. I don't use the WiFi portion, I have a separate ASUS router that's plugged into the ethernet of this modem/router to provide WiFi because this unit does NOT support MESH like my other routers do. I rely on my internet connection for streaming HD/4k (PS Vue/Netflix/etc.) and do a lot of PS4 and PC gaming and have had 0 issues in over a month of having this unit replace the one issued by Spectrum. Getting it setup on Spectrum took a 5 minute phone call and it was good to go. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Herrera

customer_reviews.title: just perfect for my network needs
customer_reviews.text: had to upgrade from docsis 2.0 cable and checked out a few brands but can't go wrong with asus. I end up picking this though i know there is a future proof cable modem from arris /motorola but i just don't see the speed going that high for a while so spending a bit more money for a few mbits doesn't seem logical...16 streams down is more then enough to handles my 4k viewing with 3 or more people watching and gaming. I did test this modem for few months now and it doesn't seem to slow down and keeps up the pace
customer_reviews.author: R.M

customer_reviews.title: Solid Device
customer_reviews.text: I just got this recently and the device is working as expected. I needed to reach out the my ISP to deactivate my old modem and to activate this one. The whole process took about 10 minutes once I had Xfinty on the line. The signal strength is excellent, I have a 3,000 square feet house and it covers every single corner of the house. I have to play a little more with the settings because I read that there is a way to assign more resources to specific devices. Overall I think is a great buy. Very happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Silvio

customer_reviews.title: Not for the novice
customer_reviews.text: I had tried to get this to replace my current equipment, confirmed that it was compatible with my ISP, speed package, etc. Got it and could never get it to activate, thought ok, maybe that's a one off, got a replacement, same issue, worked with spectrum support via phone, had them come out in person, contacted the asus tech support via email with log files from router etc, still never managed to get it activated. Also. Keep in mind I work in IT and even worked as senior support for one of the major ISPs before
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Probably going to upgrade my plan later for 400mbps to really push it but it works as advertised getting great speeds Updated review i dont know about 600 mbps speeds i upgraded to gigabit speeds and going to order a gigabit modem but i tried to max this modem out well the most ive gotten out of it is 360mbps threw a wired connection to my router cat 7 too router and cat 5e to my computer will update for speeds with my gigabit modem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so that I could manage traffic at the router rather than on each device and literally NONE of it works. Firewall? Nope. Blacklists? Zilch. Parental Controls? Nada. History? Blank. Sadly, my return window passed while I was trying to get it to work. Don’t make the same mistake I did, just use the free modem provided by your service provider.
customer_reviews.author: Alie VL

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: ASUS provides no update for this piece of crap. Does not keep the right time and always having to reboot it. I worked in IT for over 30 years, so i do know what I am doing and I just could not get it to work properly at all, so I went out and bought the Arris SBG 8300 cable modem/router and have not had anymore issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stormin' Norman

customer_reviews.title: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ASUS ROUTER APP FOR LIMITING BANDWIDTH AND NETWORK CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: ***WARNING*** THIS WIFI ROUTER IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH THE ASUS ROUTER APP shown in the description. I spent a long time on the phone trying to get access to the wireless router and now it has been escalated with no resolution at this point. Waste of $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: We really thought this would power our smarthome
customer_reviews.text: The router is constantly dropping signal, requiring restart frequently. This is a challenge, as we have quite a few smarthome devices and extensions. Likely, we have now learned that this traditional modem/router combo is no match for a mesh system. We will be looking to change to a mesh system next. Don't be fooled, go for the mesh like Netgear Orbi or GoogleWifi if you need a whole home solution!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase - saving me $$$
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year ago, I purchased this Cable Modem in lieu of renting a modem from my service provider. The cost was about 6 months of renting one, so because I had a one-year contract, I thought I could save a bit and boy was I right. This modem works great, is less obtrusive than the modem from my service provider and preforms as good as or better. I am planning on staying on with my service provider so will continue saving money each and every month!
customer_reviews.author: sacctyguy

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying Xfinity an additional $15 a month for their equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I received my modem as an open boxed item for just over $25. I feel like a fool for paying Xfinity an additional $10-12 a month for over 5 years. The modem was easy to setup and I didnt even require me to call xfinity to activate it. I have the 500 MB/s Xfinity Internet and this works great for my plan. I just ran a speed test and I am receiving 535 MB/s download and 17.9 MB/s upload speed which is even better then I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Not for the Technical Novice
customer_reviews.text: It is a really powerful device but it struggles with staying relevant. It has hard times with frame ware updates and sometimes can go out completely needing a complete reactivation of WiFi services. It isn’t supported by the ASUS app anymore also you just have to bare with it until you really get it started. Once you get a hang of it or just know a bit more about technology in the first place it works amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Customer Name

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: According to the website description it’s “the ultimate Wifi connectivity that other cable modem routers can’t compete.” Actually, it doesn’t have the power that my 10-year-old router has. When I asked ASUS for help in changing the password, they had a guy call me who wanted to charge me $160 to fix my computer instead of just answering my question as to why I couldn’t change the routers password.
customer_reviews.author: Beowulf6944

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Modem . . .except . . .
customer_reviews.text: Modem works great. It's awesome. The ONLY problem I have with it is one of the blue LED's on the front blinks quickly and continuously (letting you know you have an internet connection and it's talking). If you have the modem on your desk in front of you, the continuously blinking blue LED can become quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrianne

customer_reviews.title: Customer service and router very bad
customer_reviews.text: Updated Jan 14 2020... This router has been awful i finally got Asus to "fix it" and they will take it for 7-10 business days without giving me a replacement unless I pay for one upfront. A TERRIBLE company who makes bad routers. I will never purchase another Asus product again. Issues with WiFi constantly going out. My Engineer friend says it's because bandwidth drawn from wired connections takes away from WiFi. I'm not sure if that's true or not, I'm very disappointed that it constantly goes out about 30 times a day.
customer_reviews.author: BHeld

customer_reviews.title: No good. Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: I just got this router and was excited to have my own router and to get rid of some dead spots around the house. I couldn't even get past connecting it because the box would not read that the cable was screwed into it. I had already enabled it through my provider and should have been good to go. So I just bought this to get a task of returning it, Don't waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this and other modems using PUMA 6 chipset
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's fast, but the daily disconnects are driving me crazy. There are many issues reported with the chipset in this modem (Intel PUMA 6), and even some class action lawsuits due to bugs that cause disconnects. When a product gets more than 10% 1-star reviews like this one does, then move on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not fully compatible for Comcast/XFinity Network.
customer_reviews.text: This router/modem is advertised by both ASUS and Comcast/XFinity as compatible with the Comcast/XFinity Network. This is kind of true, but not fully. It cannot be used if you have a wireless set top box. I purchased this router/modem and subsequently wanted to add a wireless set top box. To make it work I had to remove the ASUS CM-32 router and reinstall a comcast router/modem to effect the change. I'm out $239.95 because I didn't know it was not fully compatible with their network.
customer_reviews.author: Chico52

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a new one
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found a clear support channel for diagnosing the fact that it broadcasts a 5g network that I can't connect to on any device. What it does broadcast on 2.4g is great, sometimes it drops signal randomly, but otherwise works great. Not sure if issues I'm experiencing stem from a used unit, but the new one had a two month wait so I sprung for a used one instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Have had frequent issues with losing internet connectivity. At first I thought it was the ISP but after having 2 service calls that showed no issues with the signal, it became obvious that the device was the problem. I have had to restart the device at least 4 or 5 times a week and sometimes more than once in a single day. I also tried several hard resets but that did not make any difference. When the device is working, it is very good but it is too unreliable to give it more than 1 star. This is the first ASUS product out of many I have owned that has been disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: ThankyouTexas

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had comcast come to our house to install and hook everything up for us. This product did not work at all...We ended up leasing from comcast directly instead...Now I am in the process of trying to return this item and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Keyara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device but lacks support.
customer_reviews.text: The router is excellent. I got it for open vpn, it has the feature but i worked with 3 different vpn provider but none of their service worked with this router. I got live support from the providers but did not work. and also from asus there was no firmware development it lacked after sale support. So i know the vpn is not going to work. Other than that it worked fine and excellent. But still i will not recommend because asus has no support for the device i guess.
customer_reviews.author: Md. I.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: Had issues setting up with Comcast initially. Was told by 4 Reps it wasn't compatible, which translates to them not knowing their job. 5th rep I spoke with knew what to do and took the MAC address and added it to the account and wasn't sure why the other reps couldn't figure it out. Paired with a ASUS Wireless Router and all is well. I work in IT, so I knew it was compatible and Comcast techs tend to be dumb. Have to ask for a senior tech in a level 3 support to setup so its provisioned correctly. Will update review after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: RepairLogic, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - stopped working properly after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the router after doing some research. I am very disappointed in the router, after about three months the wifi started disconnecting on a regular basis and the modem was extremely slow. I reset it and restored it to factory settings at the modem speed improved (still not great) but the 2G band on wifi would disconnect for no reason . After resetting it and restoring it a number of times, I give up. I would expect better quality than this. $225 thrown out the window. I don't think i would buy another Asus product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good router with great controls.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, my only complaint is that it takes a while to reboot and/or startup. Otherwise it has a great signal and the device controls are a must have for parents trying to limit internet time.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Strong wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: Much better signal than our last modem router. No longer need an extender to reach the office or back bedrooms. I'll chalk up the technical issues we are having to my wifi provider, xfinity. The box says it works with xfinity. We have been kicked off the wifi four times over 3 months and then when trying to get back on the wifi, the xfinity start up page pops up to register a new device. Xfinity had to and a tech out and said the router wasn't the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey & Nick

customer_reviews.title: If 48 hours is acceptable for service this is your device!!
customer_reviews.text: After buying this due to it being a Spectrum recommended Modem/Router, I have spent hours on the phone with Spectrum (who have actually been very helpful throughout), had to have new cable run to the house, an additional modem installed and then removed. Wireless would work, Ethernet wouldn’t...the list goes on. Haven’t returned it because after that much time invested I wanna see it through. Spectrum finally gave up and asked me to contact ASUS. ASUS spent 5 mins on the phone and said they needed 48 hours to get back to me. 48 hours? It’s 2019, get with it ASUS. UPDATE. 72 hours and nothing. I’m guessing it’s never happening.
customer_reviews.author: TK PhotoSTL

customer_reviews.title: nice for the modern home
customer_reviews.text: be aware this router does not support phone so if you still have a home phone you will need something else. otherwise this is the the one you should get its great, fast and looks cool, little thing that I really appreciate is that there is a button on there to turn off the flashing status lights so you don't need to worry about the distraction or the colors.
customer_reviews.author: John Riccio

customer_reviews.title: Best router for Xfinity with using a VPN
customer_reviews.text: My last router (Motorola) was only a few months old, but it continually disconnected from my vpn. After reading reviews I decided to buy a different brand. Yes, this is more expensive, but totally worth the money! We pay for up to 100 MG/S with Xfinity, but the speed was always around 30-50 with my last router. With this Asus, we stay between 115-120 every time I test it. And I’ve had no vpn issues. I had an issue with the 2G not connecting to some devices, but I called Asus customer service. There was ZERO wait time, and we got everything up and running in a matter of minutes. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth its price.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product was going to be great as everything else I've ever had made by Asus has been. However, that's not the case. The admin software is glitchy and will just reset on you at random. The router itself will drop signal constantly. Many others have had lots of problems with theirs as well. For what you pay for this thing, it should be flawless. Real disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Zach and Sarah Harner

customer_reviews.title: ASUS DOCSIS 3.0 High Speed 16 x 4 Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I was able to install and activate without calling ISP (Comcast). I did call Comcast to notify them of the removal of their router/modem, to register my equipment with them and to make sure they removed the rental charges for their equipment. They reactivated the ASUS modem. Overall, extremely easy. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R.

customer_reviews.title: Doody....
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about a week. Then it was having a lot of connectivity issues. Eventually it wouldn't recognize the coaxial cable that worked on my old router after checking to make sure the cable wasnt the issue. Asus tech support was friendly, but offered only the unplug and plug it in fixing method. Eventually they told me to just return it which I am in the process of doing.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Good router for Smart homes.
customer_reviews.text: This router has solved my problem of slow internet speeds. Like every other modern home my house is also full of smart home devices, 40+, my previous router wasn’t doing a good job in handling that many smart home devices. And that triggered the need for this purchase. Very satisfied with the product. I’ll give no stars to their tech support if I had option to do so. I emailed them many weeks before my purchase about this routers capability and they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy Asus and waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought it from Amazon and only just after 1yr its started giving me trouble for wifi connections so contacted Comcast, and the engineer verified the cable connections but still cable signal was not coming to adapter so finally he replaced it and started working, but my purchased router adapter combo is useless, so its not worth it...dont buy Asus
customer_reviews.author: Rupesh T

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst piece of equipment I have ever bought. It was replaced 3 times by amazon. Each time started router up it failed. Talked to tech support at Asus and they couldn't figure it out over phone. I spent a total of 10 hours with support between all three modems. In fact while I am writing this I am on hold with asus support. I am done and will never buy anything from asus. My next step is to go to best buy an buy a cable modem/router because I need one today. Have had no internet for 8 days now because Asus products stink
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mietlicki

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Needs To Improve Their Product
customer_reviews.text: I hooked it up to my computer and at first it worked then the 5 g went out and the 2.4 g light was on but nothing happened. We also did a reboot twice but nothing happened. A call to ASUS and the tech person said to send it back. As always, Amazon return policy is outstanding. I got my money refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's straight trash
customer_reviews.text: We've had this modem/router combo (the CM32 AC2600 model) for six months. I can objectively say this thing is pure unadulterated garbage. The WiFi goes out numerous times a day. We don't lose internet, but the WiFi just stops working. All WiFi connected devices report the internet is unavailable. Wired devices work fine. Do not buy this router, you will regret your expensive decision.
customer_reviews.author: notoriouslyKEN

customer_reviews.title: Please do NOT purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This modem requires 5-10 reboots a day. The connection from the cable provider is perfect. The modem will just start blinking and it will go out over and over all day. The first few weeks it worked fine and then it started needed to be rebooted once a day. Then multiple times a day. Now it’s constant so I have to buy a new modem. Do NOT buy this modem if you want to actually use your internet.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: What a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all. According n to asus and my internet provider (Cox) this router is supposed to work properly with my internet provider. 5 phone calls later with 8 different associates and this router does not communicate with cox system. After calling asus directly because their online router/modem setup page would not load. They told me there was no one I could speak with to try and figure the issue out. And an email will b sent in 2-4 days.... Great job since I’m working from home and need the my internet to complete my job. ASUS customer service is absolutely a joke! So before you spend 2-300 on this router please look for another option.
customer_reviews.author: robert thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent MBPS and easy Spectrum activation
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Asus Modem for a couple weeks without a problem. I had no issues with Spectrum activation and it gives me download speeds slightly faster (330mbps) than the Ubee Modem/Router I was renting. So far I'm completely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: great first impression
customer_reviews.text: first off i have charter as my isp, i got this in the mail and i was excited called my isp and got it connected and working in like 15 minutes no issues, also did a speed test and my old modem got 250mbps and this one shot up to 400 which is strange because im only paying for speeds up to 300, no connection issues yet and i love how well this first impression is and even the design looks great
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: One thing with products today is that they do not come with manuals anymore. Had to look manual up online to get some things working and not sure about the file server stuff yet. Manuals that are available online are little help and little explanations.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Peters

customer_reviews.title: A joke
customer_reviews.text: If you want your internet connection to drop every 2 other nights, then get this modem/router combo. It inexplicably crashes out of nowhere. The WiFi signal is great, the speeds are great, but it’ll drop the connection out of nowhere farrrrrr too often. If this would happen once or twice a year or even a month, I’d say it might be understandable, but it happens several times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of this router. Really a huge pain to set up. Even worse to reconnect. Spent hours trying to reconnect turning this and the modem off and on and off and on. Not enjoyable. We have a 2600 sq ft 2 story, signal wasnt great upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: ONLY 300 MBPS!! NOT 1372 AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: In Spite of having the Xfinity certification, within the service bracket of support, the company is only able to provide it with 300Mbps of service. It is not Gigabit (Gigablast) capable. Other than that, stand up equipment for a SOHO environment.
customer_reviews.author: WZ.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Setup was extremely easy, took maybe 5 minutes to get up and running. My old asus t-mobile router had a firmware bug restricting my download speed to 125mbps for some reason. Decided f it and upgraded now im getting almost 500mbps down and 25 up so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Order New, But It’s Used...
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer, this product was super easy to setup, and install. It works as intended. I am just upset with seller. Order this as a new product from amazon services, inc. Upon arrival, this product was in the original box, but clearly had been used. Antennas were not in designed location, the plastic bags that would have wrapped the product we’re removed. However, the nail is the coffin was the router named had clearly been changed. Along with the default password being changed. I factory reset it and set it up, but was disappointed in the seller giving me a pre-used product. Buyers beware of seller. Find another seller to receive this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, works great.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had no significant issues with installation. I did change a couple of settings, but the user interface is designed for the average end user, so even I was able to accomplish what I wanted. Followed the directions, set it all up locally, called my ISP (Spectrum,) and a couple minutes later I was downloading porn like my POS, three year old Motorola was never even stinkin' up the joint.
customer_reviews.author: Brains Ironically

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until the one month return period expired
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so because it was faster and supposedly better than the old one that we had purchased from our internet provider. Easy to set up and worked great. For exactly one month. Then the whole thing crashed. We thought it was our ISP and had tech support come out, who told us it was a problem with the modem. We plugged our old one back in and everything worked fine. I went online to return it and low and naturally we were 3 days out of the return period. So frustrating. I would not recommend wasting your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: kristen shattuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for its price.
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless modem for its price. Compatible with Cox’s ultimate internet speeds but not compatible with Gigablast! Do not buy it if you are planning on upgrading to Gigablast or any Gigabit speeds! It doesn’t have the right DOCSIS for it!
customer_reviews.author: Sons Lestat

customer_reviews.title: No more rental fees!
customer_reviews.text: If you're with Charter/Spectrum, save yourself some time and just CALL IN when you hook it up--it will fail the auth check until you call in and speak to provisioning. Once provisioning authorizes the device for THEIR network, it will work. Spectrum technician on-site won't make this call for you.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Modem Performs well most of the time
customer_reviews.text: It has its issues where it randomly reboots and/or just crashes. Not sure what is occurring. I have had it for about a year now and on a number of random days it has rebooted or crashed on its own. I can only imagine it is also occurring while I am not home using the internet...
customer_reviews.author: Jonh

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: every few days needs to be re booted,lame ! range is average at best ,3000 sq foot house cant even make it to all points of the home def not what i expected for performance,keeps getting worse and worse
customer_reviews.author: Excel

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy and poor internet stability
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Asus that is why I purchased the router/modem combo but they really messed this up. I would steer clear of this product. Wifi very inconsistent. Probably the worst purchase I have made in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Asus CM-16 Docsis 3.0 Cable Modem.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with Spectrum internet. Comcast is also on their list. Small package, very well vented. I do run a small computer fan under it on the next shelf below it as I have with all modems and routers.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: so much more reliable than Comcast OEM
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my OEM modem from Comcast with this. It has been 100% reliable and the range is enough to cover my 1400 sq ft house. I like that I can set my computer to take priority over other devices so the kids streaming Netflix does not lag my game.
customer_reviews.author: David VanderSchuur

customer_reviews.title: Bad router, bad tech support!
customer_reviews.text: I would avoid this router. When it worked it had tremendous range which I liked. But after a brief power outage, only about half of the wireless devices in my house could connect. No amount of resetting would fix it. Asus tech support was worthless. I returned it and went back to my old router.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tilton

customer_reviews.title: 5Ghz network radio died the day I plugged it in.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router back in May and initially when I turned it on and connected it to the network the 5g worked for the first 2min then it burned out and died. 2Ghz radio still works fine but 5g is busted. I waited too long to return it and I didn't purchase the extra coverage you can buy with it... bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Saj

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router/modem combo since shortly after it came out and have had a ton of issues. I've tried working with tech support but they haven't been able to find the cause of the issue, not that it would matter since it seems like Asus doesn't actually support this model. The only firmware available is what it was released with in April of 2017 with no plan for them to release another version to address any issues. I will probably never buy another Asus networking product due to how horrible the experience with this has been.
customer_reviews.author: Arin Tufts

customer_reviews.title: SOLD SOMETHING DIFFERENT THAN WHAT WAS ORDERED
customer_reviews.text: Amazon resold a LOCKED unit. one that CANNOT be upgraded. It has version 1.0 firmware on it and there is no possible way to upgrade it to a current version. I spoke with my ISP and with the MFG and both said they could not help. i dont care that it is 60 days past when i purchased this unit and that it had a 30 day warranty - IT ISNT WHAT I ORDERED. i spent another 45 minutes on the phone with amazon explaining the issue but didnt get anywhere. they are sticking by their policies of its past the date. this is just wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Winter

customer_reviews.title: Never lease a modem again
customer_reviews.text: Worked with Comcast even though the store employee tried arguing with me and telling me it wouldn’t all to try and keep me leasing one of their modems. Modem leasing is a huge scam and no one should ever rent a modem or router from an ISP. ALWAYS BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wood

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive description -- there is no Wifi on it
customer_reviews.text: It is just a plain old wired modem, no wifi connection at all. I complained and Amazon kept offering me discounts to keep it but didn't honor the original deal.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice P.

customer_reviews.title: Two years later and still running at 100%
customer_reviews.text: Two years later: This has been the best router I’ve ever owned, I’ve reset it maybe 6 times in the two years I’ve owned it. After two years I’m getting full bandwidth (600mbs) through Comcast. Sleek design. ASUS never lets me down.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Beware the WiFi feature
customer_reviews.text: The pros that I like about this product is the looks and the connection speed when hooked "Directly" via Ethernet.....now what I don't like is the WiFi for this modem, it refreshes alot which interrupts what your doing and it does it frequently enough to where I find it easier to use my phone data when I'm home then have to wait for it to re-establish the WiFi connection.
customer_reviews.author: Megamatt001

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spend some money to make your money back. Bought this for Specrum AKA Time Warren El Paso, TX. Got the ultra package internet speed up to 120Mbps ran a speed test my speed was 150Mbps. Bought the ASUS RT-ACRH13 router and the speed stayed the same. 2 phones 1 xbox and my laptop. Worth the buy!!!! Your a fool if you don't buy your own equipment.
customer_reviews.author: enrique rojas

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this from an Arris surfboard. I couldn't be happier. My old modem would reboot randomly and take forever to regain a connection. This one stays connected and hasn't disconnected once! Very happy with this and my other Asus products. No issues in the 6 months I've owned it!-Used with Spectrum 400mb/s
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: 16x4 Broadcom chip!
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. No issues. Speed is spot on and very low latency. Broadcom chip not intel puma. 16x4 node connection. Overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not performing as expected, may be firmware upgrade is needed.
customer_reviews.text: Love the combo features of this device. I need to uncluttered my central media center. Setting it up was really easy. But the performance is some what in predictable I have to reset this device every so often due to drop connection to bother LAn and WAN. Call tech support for support. All I was ask to do was to reset the mosem. It will works for an predictable period time. There is no firmware upgrade available. Sorry for the low rating. I have been using Asus for years and didn't expect the poor performance form this model
customer_reviews.author: xlegend

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously FAST
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously FAST!! I have 100mbps speed through xfinity and I am getting 118mbps. This thing looks bad *** and is very fast!!!! I upgraded from a netgear that was only pumping out 45mbps when I plugged in the ASUS it went up to 118mbps. Good buy don’t hesitate just buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Landon B.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with xfinity
customer_reviews.text: The product description claims this is a gigabit router that is certified to work with xfinity. After spending an hour and a half with an xfinity rep, I found that the reason I'm getting 70Mbps instead of gigabit speed is that this product uses DOCSIS 3.0 and xfinity gigabit service requires DOCSIS 3.1. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: Set up is a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, jus plug everything in reboot and follow instructions. Done...thats it..NO tech contact needed. So far so good. It's working. I'm biased on ASUS...
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome cable modem and router. It actually out performed the latest generation of modems provided by xfinity. The GUI is easy to use and has lots of enterprise features. I highly recommend for anyone looking for a great cable modem, that performs and wants granular control over their network.
customer_reviews.author: George Cosio

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but poor execution. The firmware is awful. There are no available updates from the manufacturer and it appears to be unsupported. Learn from me and Google this device before making the decision to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Support has been dropped by ASUS and Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: I can say for a fact I would not recommend buying this product as of now. First one came bricked and the 5Ghz network wasn't available due to hardware issues. Had to return and have another one shipped out. I've had the second for about 8 months and it's consistently plagued with network drops and crashes that require manual resets. Look for a better modem/router. I will either request a manufacturer return or something. Should have stayed away when the first one came bricked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wifi IP Address issues
customer_reviews.text: I had a relatively easy time setting it up, but I've been having a lot of trouble with the WiFi IP address, causing me to frequently reset it. *Update* Feb. 10,2019 It no longer runs for more than a couple of hours without having to be reset.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Far better then Comcast modem
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set up. Wifi is extremely fast and unlike Comcast modem stays connected. I put this in my office, but I will be getting another for my home.......
customer_reviews.author: K.Brown

customer_reviews.title: As good as the other Top-Sellers on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Great modem which pairs nicely with my ASUS Router. Works with Cox Communications. Was not able to use online activation, had to call 1-800 number in which service representative manually input the Model and S/N to register the modem. No fault to ASUS on that one.
customer_reviews.author: John C Gallucci

customer_reviews.title: When it works....
customer_reviews.text: When the product works it is ok. The single strength across and 1100 square foot apartment is very week. The WiFi drops multiple times. This is defiantly a purchase I regret. GO WITH SOMETHING ELSE.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bolden

customer_reviews.title: If you need a great WiFi router then look no further
customer_reviews.text: Love This WiFi and found ASUS to be so helpful when i needed help.Works great and now saves me the money i spent for equipment rental from the cable company.Thanks Asus for your help and your GREAT WiFi
customer_reviews.author: baddogIAM

customer_reviews.title: ASUS CM-16
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the modem that I was leasing from the cable co. Great price and now it'll save me $120.00 a yr. Worked great with my ASUS router easy to hook up. Small size so it doesn't take up a lot of space on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: 2hawk feathers

customer_reviews.title: Devices connect and work great on both 2G and 5G
customer_reviews.text: This router is legit. I would have paid over purchasing price for a rental unit from xfinity and now I get to keep this forever. Devices connect and work great on both 2G and 5G.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Prather

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up ASUS modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ASUS modem because I have an ASUS router and also it has the specs as indicated by my cable company. Was easy to set up and works great. Its been many months and its now paid for itself for me because I no longer have to "rent" a modem from my cable provider.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I am an older person but I was able to install this myself without having Comcast come out- I did this during the pandemic. It is an awesome product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Proflizzie

customer_reviews.title: Nice modem and router if your internet provider supports it
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great modem/router, but check with your cable company first if it's compatible with their service. It is not with WOW internet. It worked, but speeds were about 10% of what is expected. When I called WOW the second time they finally let me know this wont work with WOW. They said the CM-16 is would work if I switched. Was very easy to install and the router website worked well.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome. Great range, easy to set up interface. No longer have to use repeater. Speeds increased on hardwire and wireless by at least 15mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Randy McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Until it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, easy to set up, worked great, for nearly 7 months. Then, right in the middle of streaming a movie, it stopped working correctly. I was able to send it a reset signal via Xfinity app, so it was accessible from the coax side. The WiFi signal was strong and I was able to connect to that with no issues. But there was no connection to the internet anymore. The routing part of the thing just stopped working. And just like that, it was worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Crewless

customer_reviews.title: Received a Used Modem
customer_reviews.text: I received a used modem with a damaged box, fingerprints all over it, and a sloppily repackaged power cord. I am giving one star due to being dissatisfied with the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Mike_B622

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH BETTER THAN THE XFINITY "GATEWAY"
customer_reviews.text: Our rented unit from Xfinity was garbage. Had to re boot 2 or more times a day. I stream everything!! With this one, I may have had to do it once in the last month. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Sabourin

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to boost our WI FI signal strength and make it more easily accessible from farther areas of the house. It was successful doing both.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - needs reboot at least once a week
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace crappy one I had to rent from Comcast. When it works it's great - good signal strength. Unfortunately one of the WiFi networks (2.4 or 5g) will stop working every 4 or 5 days requiring a manual reboot of the entire router to fix. Don't buy it .
customer_reviews.author: Sean Comerford

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working shortly after set up. Will start working again after unplugging and plugging back in, but stops working again 24-48 hours later. I worked though ASUS support multiple times and could never get it resolved. This was an expensive router, and by the time it was concluded that there was nothing else to be done, the return window was passed and now I’m stuck with this junk router
customer_reviews.author: mark newton

product_meta.title: Asus Modem Router Combo - All-in-One DOCSIS 3.0 32x8 Cable Modem + Dual-Band Wireless AC2600 WIFI Gigabit Router – Certified by Comcast Xfinity, Spectrum, Time Warner Cable, Charter, and Cox
product_meta.description: Size:2534 Mbps| Style:Cable modem&RouterThe ASUS CM-32 combines a DOCSIS 3. 0 32x8 cable modem with an AC2600 Wi-Fi router powered by an Intel Puma processor to deliver full bandwidth performance and wireless coverage without monthly rental fees. Dual USB 2. 0 allows you to share printers and external USB drives, including remote access via a I cloud.
feature_bullets: Ditch the monthly cable modem rental fees save upto $120 per year
Certified by comcast xfinity, spectrum (legacy time warner cable and charter) and cox
All in one docsis 3.0 32x8 cable modem + ac2600 wifi router (4x4) provides full bandwidth internet access and expansive wireless coverage
Stay connected with 4x gigabit ethernet and 2x USB 2.0 ports for your non wifi devices like external storage and printers including support for Apple time machine

Perfect for streaming and gaming in hd, dual bands (2.4ghz / 5ghz) featuring the latest 802.11ac 32x8 channel bonding technology deliver upto 1.3 gbps download speeds; Ac input : 110v to 240v(50 to 60hz); Dc output : 19 v with max; 3.42 a current

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars805 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
